thread.title: Update on the latest in sports:
thread.title_full: Update on the latest in sports:

author: wtopstaff
title: Update on the latest in sports:
text:
Home » News » Sports » NHL » Update on the latest… Update on the latest in sports: By The Associated Press October 20, 2015 10:30 am 
MLB-LCS SCHEDULE 
Jays and Royals start the day 
UNDATED (AP) — Following last night’s 11-8 win in front of their own fans, the Toronto Blue Jays are attempting to even up the American League Championship Series this afternoon at 2-2. Former New York Mets and Texas Rangers teammates Chris Young and R.A. Dickey are squaring off in this game. Knuckleballer Dickey is coming off 4 2/3rd innings of one-run ball for the Jays in Game 4 of the ALDS against Texas, while Young gave up just one run in 11 1/3 innings over his last two regular-season starts for the Royals and then one run out of the bullpen in the first game of their ALDS with Houston. 
The third game in the National League Championship Series is being played this evening in Chicago. The Cubs hit the home turf down two games to none in the NLCS as the Mets won the first two games in New York. The pitching matchup has Jacob deGrom going for the Mets against Kyle Hendricks. DeGrom, the 2014 National League Rookie of the Year, is coming off back to back wins over two of the top pitchers in the game, Clayton Kershaw and Zack Greinke (GREHN’-kee) of the Dodgers. 
After dropping the first two games of the series the Cubs are turning to 25-year old right-hander Kyle Hendricks who won eight games in his first big-league season. It won’t be easy for New York as the Cubs have won 51 games on the home field this season and the Mets have not won at Wrigley since May 19, 2013. 
NHL-SCHEDULE 
Habs put perfect record on the line 
UNDATED (AP) — Two of the hottest teams in the NHL face off tonight in Montreal as the Canadiens play host to the Blues. Montreal is the final unbeaten team in the NHL with a mark of 6-0 while the Blues are 5-1. The Canadiens are looking to extend a franchise record for consecutive wins to start a season, while tonight’s game concludes a season-opening six game road trip for St. Louis. The Blues by the way are 11-1-2 in their past 14 games in Canadian cities. 
Pittsburgh has won two in a row after dropping its first three games of the season. Tonight the Penguins are hosting Florida in the first of three straight road games for Florida. A year ago the Pens won two of the three games these teams played. 
Columbus is off to its worst start ever with a record of 0-6. This evening the Blue Jackets are home to the New York Islanders, who have won three straight. This game is the first of five between the clubs this season. 
A pair of teams each with four wins on the season face off tonight in Nashville. The game has the Predators entertaining Tampa Bay. 
Arizona opens a five game east coast road swing tonight with a game at New Jersey, while the Flyers are home to the Stars and the Capitals kick off a three game road trip in Calgary after opening the season with four games at home. 
BRITISH OPEN 
Open heading to Ireland 
PORTRUSH, Northern Ireland (AP) — For the first time in nearly 70 years the British Open is going to be held outside of England or Scotland when it is staged in Northern Ireland in 2019. The Royal and Ancient, the organizing body of the Open, has announced that the Open in five years will be held at Royal Portrush, which served as host once before back in 1951. 
The push to bring the Open back to Northern Ireland gained momentum after three players from the country, Graeme McDowell, Darren Clarke and Rory McIlroy, won majors since 2010. McIlroy is now a four-time major champion and one of the world’s best players. Topics:
